abstract: Federal appeals court reverses almost $24 million in damage awards for two-class action suits brought against Tyson Foods, citing lack of evidence; suits claimed company cheated thousands of employees of two plants in Nebraska out of wages.
lead_paragraph: Tyson Foods won the reversal of nearly $24 million in damage awards in two class actions claiming it had cheated thousands of hourly workers out of wages.

headline.main: $24 Million in Awards Reversed in Workers’ Suit Against Tyson
headline.print_headline: $24 Million in Awards Reversed in Workers’ Suit Against Tyson

snippet: Tyson Foods won the reversal of nearly $24 million in damage awards in two class actions claiming it had cheated thousands of hourly workers out of wages.
